mūhā.comment: [openrouter: openrouter/sonoma-dusk-alpha] Nominal form indicating a state of confusion or delusion, often used in contexts of moral or cognitive error in Pāḷi texts.

abhisāpāyaṃ.meaning_2: by means of cursing; by condemnation; by means of accusation
abhisāpāyaṃ.comment: [openrouter: openrouter/sonoma-dusk-alpha] The form is instrumental singular of the tatpuruṣa compound abhisāpāya 'means of curse'. The first member abhisāpa is derived from abhi + √sap, and the second aya means 'means, way' derived from √i.

abhisapāyaṃ.meaning_2: means of cursing; method of abuse
abhisapāyaṃ.comment: [openrouter: openrouter/sonoma-dusk-alpha] The word is a tatpuruṣa compound where 'abhisapa' (curse, abuse) is qualified by 'āya' (instrumental sense of 'aya', meaning means or way), indicating the instrument or method of cursing. No contextual sentences provided, so meaning is derived from components.

tvevidaṃ.comment: [openrouter: openrouter/sonoma-dusk-alpha] This is a sandhi form combining the indeclinable 'tu' (however), 'eva' (just, only), and the neuter pronoun 'idaṃ' (this). Likely used adverbially or pronominally in context to mean 'but just this' or 'however this very thing'.
